attributes.action: Use "green taxes" on "green" initiatives and transportation taxes on transportation or abolish the tax
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We pay 400% (or thereabouts) tax on petrol and diesel on the grounds that this is a "green" initiative. (Almost £5 per gallon, of which £4 is tax of various types; i.e. 400% taxation).

However, there is no alternative in many cases other than to use the car.

It would seem that the taxes so raised are not spent on making transportation greener.

Surely the way to do this is to do radical things - perhaps including  decreasing the taxes on diesel / LPG / etc.

Without schemes like this, these taxes will increasingly be seen as a cynical ploy to extract taxes without losing too many votes - a neat trick, but hardly "green".

This petition asks government to spend the money on "green" initiatives like the more radical suggestions above or come clean and abolish the tax.
